abstracts.cdata!:
The Bankin'ny Indostria (BNI)
            (Barque National pour le Development Industriel) Project in
            Madagascar was achieved. (BNI)'s performance was
            generally satisfactory as a commercial financial
            institution, but less so as a development institution. The
            project's institution building objective of upgrading
            BNI was only partially achieved, partly due to factors
            exogenous to the financial institution such as adverse
            macroeconomic conditions and considerable Government
            interferences. Given the fact that the Government has a
            majority equity participation, its actual influence on
            crucial operational and institutional decision making was
            significant which, however, blurred to a large extent of
            BNI' s management functions and responsibilities. One
            of the future key tasks, therefore, is to make BNI a more
            independent, organizationally and financially autonomous
            institution with clear objectives and responsibilities so
            that it can play a more active and effective role in support
            of Government's future industrial development strategy.
            In essence, the experience with the first International
            Development Association (IDA) financed line of credit to BNI
            suggests that the operation was generally successful in
            financing a number of priority Industrial and Small Scale
            (SSE) subprojects. In operational decision making, and
            partly us a result of continued weaknesses in BNI's
            operational and financial management and organization.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would support the
            country's growing industrial sector and BNI's
            crucial role by: (i) providing BNI with part of its foreign
            exchange requirements to finance its projected lending to
            artisans/SSEs and medium-scale industrial enterprises during
            the period September 1979 through December 1981; and (ii)
            strengthening BNI and providing funds for technical
            assistance to the institution. There are uncertainties about
            how the sector will evolve in the context of transition
            toward a system of socialist enterprises. This may create a
            climate not conducive to private investment, particularly
            foreign, and may result in somewhat reduced industrial growth.
